Description: Fragment of lid of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery stemmed bowl; white slip; interior reserved; exterior: black-figure decoration in two friezes separated by double line; above, confronted sphinxes (on left, mouth, chin, neck and one front leg of one sphinx; on right, front leg of second sphinx); incised rosette with added red centre and part of incised rising rosette as filling ornament; below, bull (part of tail, body, neck, head including ear, horn and eye remaining; with added red on rump, shoulder and eye), to right.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), Stratum AΠ1 ('bothros' / 'trench with bowls'), AΠ190 or AP20 from the bottom of the sand in the temenos
Curator's comments: 'A947' is written in pencil on the interior surface, the registration number from Smith's unpublished catalogue.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 313, no. 1331, pl. 172)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. V, no. 56)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2080) (phase 2)
